intro: Urostigma cunninghamii, commonly known as the Grey Box, is a small to medium-sized shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its dense, greyish-green foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in woodland and heathland habitats. Its leaves are leathery and arranged alternately along the stems, and it produces small, woody pods that contain seeds. Urostigma cunninghamii is well adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of native vegetation in its range.
